content: copyright infringement knit little sea creatures designed by lorraine pistorio i hope you enjoy creating your own little sea creature after completing each arm place them as you did the first one on yarn holders a & b until all 5 arms have been placed on yarn holders a and b underside placing the stitches from yarn holder b onto the needles… starfish place the 50 sts from beginning the arms… make 5 yarn holder b onto leaving long tail cast on 12 sts the needles so the and join in-the-round… stitches on yarn rounds 1-9 k holder a are on the 10 k2 m1 x 2 k4 m1 k2 x 2 = 16 sts inside of the circle 11 k when you join to knit 12 k2 m1 k4 x 3 m1 k2 = 20 sts in the round 13 k do not bind off cut yarn leaving long tail this tail will be used later to close the openings between beginning the underside of the starfish… the arms stuff arm…now at the cast-on edge round 1 attach working yarn and knit around thread yarn tail onto large-eyed blunt needle insert 2 k3 k2tog x 10 = 40 sts needle through the outer loops of the 12 cast-on 3 k stitches and pull up to gather and secure 4 k2tog x 20 = 20 sts place the 5 k first 10 6 k2tog x 10 = 10 sts stitches 7 k onto a do not bind off cut yarn yarn leaving long tail holder a and thread yarn tail onto large-eyed blunt place the last 10 stitches onto a different needle thread needle color yarn holder b through loops of the remaining 10 sts and pull up to gather and secure 3 inquiries contact rainebodesigns@yahoo com like rainebo designs on facebook http //www facebook com/rainebo-designs-1732403310368724/ ©2017 lorraine pistorio this pattern is not to be sold or given for free to others if you use this pattern to make items for commercial use please give me credit for the pattern please feel free to sell any completed items made from my designed pattern or donate any completed items to charity do not copy reproduce sell and/or distribute this pattern in any form this design and material are copyrighted and protected by federal copyright infringement knit little sea creatures designed by lorraine pistorio i hope you enjoy creating your own little sea creature continuing now with the top of the starfish… place the 50 sts from yarn holder a onto the needles underside turtle beginning the legs… make 4 round 1 attach working yarn and knit around leaving long tail and using turtle color a 2-4 k cast on 12 sts and join in-the-round… 5 k3 k2tog ssk k3 x 5 = 40 sts rounds 1-9 k 6 k 10 k3 m1 k6 m1 k3 = 14 sts 7 k2 k2tog ssk k2 x 5 = 30 sts 11 k 8 k 12 k2 m1 k3 m1 k4 m1 k3 m1
